messages: 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (19:37): updated http://simon.html5.org/specs/aria-proposal with the new svg proposal
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (19:38): removed html:role, added <svg:* role="" aria-foo="">. removed some notes
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (19:41): now i need to update the test cases...
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (19:59): updated the test cases at http://simon.html5.org/test/aria/role/
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:00): ...and http://simon.html5.org/test/aria/states/
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:12): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: why would svg need aria- for aria?
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:13): when it has namespaces?
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:13): are we proposing only supporting aria- and not aaa: ?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:14): yeah
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:15): so we're trying to kill the need for namespaces in aria at all
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:15): yes
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:15): fine, but, doesn't that need to be in the svg spec?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:16): it's a standalone proposal

944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315 (20:16): I still hold to my moderate-strength objection - it seems goofy to prefix one attribute with aria- and not another, and it seems like that limits the applicability (because the language can't use "role" then).
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:16): 944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315, my argument about that before was that role= denotes the widget where aria-* denotes the state
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:17): but I don't really care
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:17): i don't care that much but time is short for me on this release
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:17): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: just as much as it needs to be in the html spec
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:17): i think i need to see that the svg group is on board with it before i code it up, but it's cool with  me
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:18): the proposal came from the svg group unless i'm mistaken
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:18): i need to go for a minute
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (20:18): but i'll catch up on it later
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:18): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: is the proposal coming from there a matter of public record somewhere?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:19): there's some discussion on www-svg
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:20): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-svg/2007Oct/0013.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:21): so is the time ripe for tackling xlink:href? ;-)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:22): if they prefer role="" over html:role="" ... :)
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:22): it has to happen at some point
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:23): though xlink:href is interoperable in svg... no?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:23): yeah
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:23): but i guess UAs can support both href and xlink:href for some time
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:24): I would imagine a solution where you can specify both href="" and xlink:href="" where the latter would take precedence
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:24): IIRC back in April, xlink:href didn't quite work in WebKit
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:24): that is, if backwards compat is desired, otherwise href= would prolly take precedence
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:25): hmm, TAG discussed how people should write HTML

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:25): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: the CC badge in http:/ b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9.iki.fi/thesis/html5-conformance-checker.xhtml is not clickable in WebKit
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:27): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0: TagSoupIntegration-54?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:27): yeah
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:27): it's not really clear to me what they're doing though, but I suppose it has some purpose
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:28): eek. XSD mentioned
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:28): for instance
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:29): pointer?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:30): www-tag "minutes"
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:30): see http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-tag/2007Oct/0023.html
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (20:30): just found it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:31): what Raman says about scripting and well-defined has been fixed as of HTML5 hasn't it?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:31): yeah
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:31): maybe he means it's ugly
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:31): it can be ugly but well-defined

944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315 (20:32): (sorry in a meeting) - I just meant if we have an un-prefixed attribute directly in HTML5, then we own the semantics of that attribute - so ARIA can't change it later, and we might add things to it for other HTML uses.

e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:33): 944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315, yeah, I suppose that's true, although in practice I would expect the WG to evaluate such additions based on existing content and implementations
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:34): 944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315, any updates on the review btw?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (20:34): (of HTML5)
944facfeb153b4f01916a0f166fcc315 (20:34): not yet.  Sorry.  I've asked my management for more support.
